summary: After upgrading to TypeScript SDK 1.14.0, workflows using signals with `condition` are failing with phantom `CancelledFailure` errors. The issue appears to be a race condition introduced in 1.14.0, as downgrading to 1.13.1/1.13.2 resolves the problem and the same code works on the earlier version.
userImpact: Workflows in production fail unexpectedly with CancelledFailure errors when using signals with conditions, disrupting business workflows until versions are downgraded.
rootCause: A race condition was introduced in version 1.14.0 in the signal and condition handling code, specifically in the cancellation scope or workflow signal processing.
proposedFix: Fix #1871 was released in 1.14.1 to address the race condition in signal and condition handling.
workaround: Downgrade to version 1.13.2 or 1.13.1 to avoid the issue; reset affected workflows to the signal event and they will run correctly.
resolutionDetails: The issue was fixed in version 1.14.1 via PR #1871, which addressed the race condition in signal and condition processing.
keyQuote: A race condition seems to have been introduced since we do observe some of our workflows succeeding with a signal and condition.
